data.title: Saginaw Heritage receiver Chris Parker earns Associated Press second-team all-state honor
data.meta_description: Parker, the 2020 Hawkins Award winner, will play for Central Michigan next season.
data.text:
Chris Parker continues to bring in honors, despite a disappointing 2020 high school football season.

The Saginaw Heritage receiver earned Associated Press Division 1-2 football second-team all-state honors after claiming the Hawkins Award, which is given to the top high school senior football player in Saginaw County.

MORE: Meet the Associated Press Division 1-2 football all-state team

Parker, who has signed to play for Central Michigan University next season, was a first-team Saginaw Valley League pick on both offense and defense.

The 6-foot-3, 175-pound receiver only played in five games for COVID-related reasons, with the Hawks losing all five. He only played three games with starting quarterback Carter Sullivan but still finished with 33 catches for 467 yards and four touchdowns.

He ran six times for 66 yards, adding 29 tackles and two interceptions on defense.

SVL North champion Midland High placed four players on the honorable mention list: Al Money, Chase Mahabir, Hunter Kruger and Eli Gordon. Midland Dow’s Dawson Studebaker and Hayden Hetherington also earned honorable mention.

The 2020 Division 1-2 Associated Press All-State football team, selected by a panel of 11 Michigan sports writers:

PLAYER OF THE YEAR

Brady Rose, Muskegon Mona Shores, Sr.
